content:
Hi, I'm switching from Lean3 to Lean4 in VS Code.

Following the instructions: https://leanprover.github.io/lean4/doc/quickstart.html
Since I never got the expected "Elan" popup, per instructions, I ran "elan default leanprover/lean4:nightly", which gave me:

info: syncing channel updates for 'nightly'
info: latest update on nightly, lean version nightly-2023-07-12
info: downloading component 'lean'
>error: binary package was not provided for 'linux'

Seems suspicious... VS Code says "waiting for language server to start", but the VS Code terminal doesn't say anything.
You probably need to elan self update first

That's it, thank you!!
I had updated to the latest elan version via Ubuntu apt (which brought me to 1.4.0), but it seems Elan can self-update all the way to 2.0.0.
John Nicol has marked this topic as resolved.
The Ubuntu/Debian version of elan has unfortunately been broken for a while.

It should be fixed in a future Ubuntu release though: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/.22binary.20package.20was.20not.20provided.20for.20'linux'.22.20on.20Ubuntu/near/313434078
